items.title: Pride and Prejudice
items.description: Jane Austen's masterpiece about the Bennet sisters, particularly Elizabeth, and her tumultuous relationship with the proud Mr. Darcy.
items.author: Jane Austen

items.title: Girl, Interrupted
items.description: Based on Susanna Kaysen's memoir about her stay in a mental institution in the 1960s.
items.author: James Mangold

items.title: Starry Night
items.description: One of Vincent van Gogh's most famous works, painted in June 1889.
items.author: Vincent van Gogh

items.title: The Road Not Taken
items.description: A poem about life choices and paths taken.
items.author: Robert Frost
items.content:
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood,
And sorry I could not travel both
And be one traveler, long I stood
And looked down one as far as I could
To where it bent in the undergrowth...

items.title: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
items.author: Oscar Wilde
items.context: Often attributed to Oscar Wilde, this quote emphasizes authenticity.

items.title: Mona Lisa
items.description: The most famous portrait painting in the world.
items.author: Leonardo da Vinci

items.title: Ozymandias
items.description: A sonnet about the impermanence of power and the legacy of rulers.
items.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
items.content:
I met a traveller from an antique land,
Who said—"Two vast and trunkless legs of stone
Stand in the desert. . . . Near them, on the sand,
Half sunk a shattered visage lies...

items.title: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
items.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
items.context: From Roosevelt's first inaugural address during the Great Depression, 1933.

items.title: Guernica
items.description: A powerful anti-war painting depicting the bombing of Guernica, Spain.
items.author: Pablo Picasso

items.title: Do I contradict myself? Very well, then I contradict myself.
items.author: Walt Whitman
items.context: From 'Song of Myself' in Leaves of Grass, embracing the complexity of human nature.

items.title: The Persistence of Memory
items.description: Famous surrealist painting with melting clocks in a dreamscape.
items.author: Salvador Dalí

items.title: If—
items.description: A poem written as paternal advice on qualities of an ideal man.
items.author: Rudyard Kipling
items.content:
If you can keep your head when all about you
Are losing theirs and blaming it on you,
If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you,
But make allowance for their doubting too...
